data: It is impure because it uses the IO. IO is a side-effect.
This is impure since it does IO and therefore has side effects.
Since say(String text) deals with an IO operation which is clearly impure.
Because inside there is an IO action. This is a side effect
This method `say` has IO action, which is a kind of side effect.
The method say is not pure because it can accesses System.out to print
It is using another method (System.out.println(text)) so it is not pure.
it output something on the system and that makes a function impure (accessing I/O).
No, is not pure because there is an output to the terminal, there is a side effect
System.out.println() has a side effect (it outputs something). A pure function has no side effects, so say() is not pure.
it prints on the output
println causes a side effect, which means say it's not pure.
It is not pure as it prints something to the standard output
The method is impure because it prints, thus producing a side effect.
It has a side effect: it affects the program's output.
because it has side effect with print
It produces a side effect.
Method say has side effect
It results system output, which is a side-effect.
probably create side effect then is not pure
The method is performing IO, modifying the global state of the program.
Because the function does not alter the state of the program - it just takes an argument and produces an output using that argument.
Method say does I/O (specifically, outputs a string). I/O operations are impure, thus the method is not pure.
since void say(String text) uses I/O operations it implies that it has side-effects which make it non-pure
The method say is not pure since it is doing an IO operation.
Pure methods does not allow IO. Say is printing the text.
It writes to the standard output, i.e. it does IO, so it cannot be pure, given that it interacts with the output (of the function) world, by definition.
No, because it performs an output operations (print a text)
Pure functions don't have side effects, including IO (println does IO)
say method is not pure because it have side effects: print variable text
This method has a side effect that is a screen print, so it cannot be consider a pure method.
Method say is not pure as it has IO side effect, it print to the console.
Pure functions have no side effect. Method say print text variable that is a side effect (IO)
